basics.name: Asha Misra
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer seeking a role where I can apply my creativity and attention to detail toward building software that enriches peoples' lives. With experience developing zoo and museum exhibitions, I think like a user and make elegant, efficient, and effective products.

work.summary: Currently training as a full-stack developer in General Assembly's 12-week Software Engineering Immersive program, covering HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJS, Node, MongoDB, Express, SQL, Python, and Django
highlights: Fieldwork Flashcards, an educational game built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and EoL and GBIF APIs (https://aafmisra.github.io/fieldwork-flashcards)
Rapid Recipe, a web app that allows users to search recipes by ingredients, built with ReactJS and Edamam Recipe Search API, deployed with Heroku (https://rapid-recipe.herokuapp.com)

BookBear, a digital TBR pile. MERN stack with full CRUD capability. I acted as project manager on a team with three of my cohort-mates. Deployed to Heroku and Atlas (https://book-bear.herokuapp.com/books)

What Cheer, a digital daily gratitude journal with a React frontend and Python/Django API backend, featuring JWT for user authentication. I was project manager for this two-person team. Deployed to Heroku (https://what-cheer.herokuapp.com)

work.position: Museum Exhibition Content Developer and Interpretive Writer
work.summary: Developed exhibit content, conducted visitor studies, and designed interpretive plans for 9 museum and corporate clients. Maintained strong rapport with clients throughout the planning, design, and fabrication process. Implemented processes for version control to keep content organized through many iterations.
highlights: Blackstone Valley National Heritage Corridor Visitor Center

work.summary: Managed Altru and Doubleknot registration software for hundreds of educational programs, ensuring that thousands of people could experience these programs each year
highlights: Migrated complex program registrations from Doubleknot to Altru
Developed automated roster creation system using Altru and Excel Powerpivot, saving the department 8 hours of work per week
As department liaison, I communicated with other departments and represented the Education team on many zoowide projects

work.summary: Aided the Manager of Interpretation and Graphics, which included assisting with exhibit development and supervising a team of live interpreters
highlights: Facilitated animal interactions with zoo visitors: seal and giraffe feedings, live animal presentations
Oversaw the team of live interpreters: coordinated schedules, and resolved issues between coworkers, animals, and zoo visitors
